title: rustc is passing an unrecognized option to gcc ('--enable-long-section-names')
body:
I'm basically trying to build the [gfx](https://github.com/gfx-rs/gfx) examples, but MinGW is failling everytime. Isn't this an `rustc` internal fail? Can it be solved (say, by not touching in the gfx source)?

**`rustc` version**

```sh
$ rustc -V
rustc 1.28.0 (9634041f0 2018-07-30)
```

**Log**

```sh
$ cargo build --bin compute --target=x86_64-pc-windows-gnu --features dx12
   Compiling [blah... blah... blah]

   Compiling hal-examples v0.1.0 (file:///home/hydroper/OuterRustLibs/gfx/examples)
error: linking with `gcc` failed: exit code: 1
  |
  = note: "gcc" "-Wl,--enable-long-section-names" "-fno-use-linker-plugin" "-Wl,--nxcompat" "-nostdlib" "-m64" "/home/hydroper/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/lib/crt2.o" "/home/hydroper/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/lib/rsbegin.o" "-L" "/home/hydroper/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/lib"
```
